p: Most recommendations from dermatology societies [ 19â€“ 21], but also from other specialties that treat immune-mediated diseases (rheumatology [ 22] and gastroenterology [ 23]) recommend patients to discontinue or postpone immunosuppressive or biologic therapy in the event of COVID-19 diagnosis until the patient recovers from the infection. However, the decision to stop or withhold treatment is left to the joint consideration of the patient and physician, pondering the risk/benefit on a case-by-case basis depending on the risk of SARS-CoV-2 infection.
